newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.08 rupees down at 42.73 to the dollar in the kerb market on Tuesday because of strong demand for the dollar and dealers said it could fall further.
They said a drop in the supply of dollars from Gulf states pushed the rupee down near the close and may keep it under pressure on Wednesday.

The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 6.75 percent, up from 6.50 percent at Monday's close.
